Undergrad Reading Group

Welcome for the homepage for our undergraduate reading group at the University of Virginia. We are a part of Dr. Yanjun Qi’s QData group. For questions, suggestions, or if you’d like to join, contact Jack Morris.

Readings

We spent our first six weeks reading the online book “Neural Networks and Deep Learning” by Michael Nielsen.

Week 1 (2019-09-29): DNN C1 (Slides, by Jack Morris)

Week 2 (2019-10-12): DNN C2 (Slides, by Eli Lifland)

Week 3 (2019-10-27): DNN C3 (Slides, by Jeffrey Yoo)

Week 4 (2019-11-03): DNN C4, “A visual proof that neural nets can compute any function” (Slides, by Kevin Ivey)

Week 5 (2019-11-10): DNN C5 (Slides, by Jack Morris)

Week 6 (2019-11-17): DNN C6 (Slides, by Alan Zheng)

Week 7 (2019-12-01): “The Lottery Ticket Hypothesis: Finding Sparse, Trainable Neural Networks” (Slides, by Jack Morris)
